intro: Piratinera lecointei, commonly known as the Lecointe's piratinera, is a rare shrub native to the dry forests of Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to arid conditions, with deep roots that help it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
